ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Nineteenth-century sculpture, how to look at sculptures/art objects
I learned a lot about art historical analysis and about sculpture in the 19th century. Also learned how to write a research paper.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: Super interesting content, learned a lot about sculpture
Weaknesses: Some of the readings were a bit dry

Strengths: Class discussions were great. We more often than not went to the different museums to see some of the art we were talking about. The feedback on my research paper rough draft was extremely helpful and thought-out. And Professor Ferando is very kind and passionate about the subject. I also loved that it was a small class.  
Weaknesses: None

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, highly recommend!! I didn't know what to expect going into the course, but I came out with a new appreciation for sculpture. The course is highly interactive and we were able to look at and interact with really cool objects.

I would absolutely recommend this class to another student. It may very well be my favorite class I've taken at Yale. I looked forward to our discussions every week. We had thoughtful, interesting discussions but still laughed and had fun. The small class size made for a really great environment where I felt confident to share my opinions. We had weekly readings with reading responses which helped me think about what I liked or found thought-provoking about the reading that week. I actually really enjoyed the research paper project and the feedback I received on it was truly the most helpful feedback I have ever received in a humanities class. And everything about this class made me more excited about art history and about learning in general. Definitely recommend taking this class!
